result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Herbert D Wolff was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied - see assessment report
Cash bond applied - see assessment report

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the MVD.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Credit for 132 days, if probation is revoked.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
